label: ZT1101
info_overview:
Portable Controller with Remote Control Keyfob:

  • Micro USB Charge (5V)
  • Lithium Rechargeable Battery (280mAH)
  • Setting Mode (Inclusion/Exclusion/Association/Learning/Shift)
  • Control Mode (Arm/Disarm, On/Off Control)
info_inclusion:
To “Include” into (adding into) an existing network: Put the Z-Wave™ Gateway or Controller into learn mode to add the keyfob into your controller. To get in to “inclusion” mode, the distance between sensor and controller is suggested to be within one meter.

Under Control Mode: press button 1 and 4 together till the red LED flashes

Under Setup Mode: press button 3 and 4 together till the red LED flashes
info_exclusion:
To “Exclude” from (removing from) an existing network: Put the Z-Wave™ Gateway or Controller into learn mode to remove the keyfob into/from your controller. To get in to “exclusion” mode, the distance between sensor and controller is suggested to be within one meter.

Under Control Mode: press button 1 and 4 together till the red LED flashes

Under Setup Mode: press button 3 and 4 together till the red LED flashes
info_wakeup: Press button 2 and 3 together until green LED flashes
category_description: Any portable or hand-held device that controls the status of something, e.g. remote control, keyfob etc.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

-<ProductExport xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">

<Id>1706</Id>

<Name>Keyfob</Name>

<Description>Portable Controller with Remote Control Keyfob: * Micro USB Charge (5V) * Lithium Rechargeable Battery (280mAH) * Setting Mode (Inclusion/Exclusion/Association/Learning/Shift) * Control Mode (Arm/Disarm, On/Off Control) </Description>

<Description_Short>Portable Controller with Remote Control Function ...</Description_Short>

<Brand>Vision</Brand>

<Identifier>ZT1101US-5</Identifier>

<CertificationNumber>ZC10-16045040</CertificationNumber>

<OemVersion>HW: 1 FW: 0.09</OemVersion>

<HardwarePlatform>ZM5101</HardwarePlatform>

<ZWaveVersion>6.51.06</ZWaveVersion>

<LibraryType>Portable Controller</LibraryType>

<DeviceType>Remote Control - Simple</DeviceType>

<RoleType>Portable Controller</RoleType>

<ManufacturerId>0x0109</ManufacturerId>

<ProductTypeId>0x1002</ProductTypeId>

<ProductId>0x0202</ProductId>

<FrequencyName>U.S. / Canada / Mexico</FrequencyName>

<UserIcon>0B01</UserIcon>

<InstallerIcon>0B01</InstallerIcon>

<ProductUrl/>

<SupportUrl/>

<ManualUrl>https://Products.Z-WaveAlliance.org/ProductManual/File?folder=&filename=Manuals/1706/ZT1101-5 Keyfob_R1_20150703.pdf</ManualUrl>

<InclusionDescription>To “Include” into (adding into) an existing network: Put the Z-Wave™ Gateway or Controller into learn mode to add the keyfob into your controller. To get in to “inclusion” mode, the distance between sensor and controller is suggested to be within one meter.</InclusionDescription>

<ExclusionDescription>To “Exclude” from (removing from) an existing network: Put the Z-Wave™ Gateway or Controller into learn mode to remove the keyfob into/from your controller. To get in to “exclusion” mode, the distance between sensor and controller is suggested to be within one meter.</ExclusionDescription>

<LearnModeDescription> * Keyfob should not include any node* Under Control Mode: Press button 1 and 4 together till the red LED flashes to include into other Z-Wave network.* Under Setup Mode: Press button 3 and 4 together till the red LED flashes to include into other Z-Wave network.  It will send NWI NIF info.* Keyfob will return to sleep after 5 seconds if no inclusion nor exclusion. </LearnModeDescription>

<ResetDescription>Press 4 buttons together for 10 seconds. The LED colors will turn red after 2 seconds for 2 seconds and turn green for another 2 seconds. Keyfob will send “Device Reset Locally Notification” command and reset to the factory default. (Red LED flashes fast means reset completely). Remark: This is to be used only in the case of primary controller being inoperable or otherwise unavailable. </ResetDescription>

<WakeupDescription/>

<OtherSpecialFeaturesDescription/>
